title: Is it necessary to read the NCERT of physics? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: NCERT physics is completely good and enough for the preparation of boards exam as well as for NEET and JEE also. But remember one thing, not ratta mar style you have to understand each and every concepts and formula as well. HC VERMA is a good reference book for physics preparation it helps you to practice in examples and also it helps you to understand concepts clearly… Other than NCERT I think you don't need to learn anything because NCERT helps you to practice more in Examples and objectives as well.  MTG is also good for objectives preparation and for NCERT solutions you have one of the best application which helps you a lot for doubt solutions name of that application is Toppr: the better learning app. I hope my answer helps you. Thank you 👍 All the best!!
